data.title: Switch Editor to a Telepath Model subclass
data.body: This depends on #1283. I've added some features to telepath to make it easier to convert serialization specs. You can now call `replicate` on any document, even orphans.

data.title: Serialized markers are unserialized at the bottom of the buffer
data.body:
You can see this in bookmarks:
1. Make a bookmark.
2. Reload the editor
3. See bookmark at the bottom of the buffer. Why?

My assumption is that the buffer is reloaded / set again after the markers are deserialized. If anyone has any insight into this, lemmie know. I'm going to dig in a bit. 

atom/bookmarks#3

data.title: Fix `grunt download-atom-shell` on Windows
data.body:
Fixed a missing unzip dependency so that we can download atom-shell on windows again.

@paulcbetts this should get you back to building atom master again.

data.title: Reopen closed pane items in workspace â€“ by uri instead of deserializing
data.body:
Serializing and deserializing closed pane items was turning into a pain
with the new telepath changes that are phasing out this kind of on the
fly serialization. Reopening by uri saves memory and simplifies panes
enormously. If we want non-uri reopening we can revisit it later when
telepath models are better integrated.

data.title: Upload releases to atom/atom-master-builds repo
data.body:
Makes them reachable on travis, see them [here](https://github.com/atom/atom-master-builds/releases).

Previously they were uploaded to the draft release in this repo which made them inaccessible by travis since only people with push access can see draft releases, and the travis ci team only has pull access.

data.title: Upload master builds to releases
data.body: This uploads the build for the master branch to releases, associated with the latest draft release.

data.title: Remove instance variable declarations
data.body:
I was the big pusher for this, but I've changed my tune. I think we should move them to the constructor. So this:

``` coffeescript
class TextBuffer extends telepath.Model
  @properties
    text: -> new telepath.String('', replicated: false)
    digestWhenLastPersisted: null

  stoppedChangingDelay: 300
  stoppedChangingTimeout: null
  conflict: false

  constructor: ->
    super
```

Would become this:

``` coffeescript
class TextBuffer extends telepath.Model
  @properties
    text: -> new telepath.String('', replicated: false)
    digestWhenLastPersisted: null

  constructor: ->
    @stoppedChangingDelay = 300
    @stoppedChangingTimeout = null
    @conflict = false

    super
```

data.title: Upgrade to telepath 0.65.0. Fixes #1197
data.body: I now have a real solution in place. Whenever we invert a patch that updates a non replicated array, we also include updates for any markers with timestamps that are newer than the patch being inverted. This prevents us from failing to update markers that are newer than the operation we are undoing.

data.title: Atom Public Release Priorities
data.body:
## Top Priorities
- [ ] Clean up generated docs
- [x] Improve "your first package" docs
- [ ] Decide how to deal with TextMate Snippets (ones with `TM_SELECTED_TEXT`) style env vars.
## Speed
- [ ] Startup performance
- [x] Opening additional files performance
- [ ] Typing performance (low priority)
- [ ] Scrolling via cursor movement performance (low priority)
- [ ] Folding speed (low priority)
## Stability
- [ ] Trickle out to more alpha users
- [ ] Make soft wrap great
## UI Polish
- [x] Settings view
- [x] Icon
- [ ] Package installation / upgrades / etc
- [ ] Make editing the user keymap easy
- [ ] Streamline auto update
- [ ] Any last keybinding changes
## Docs
- [x] Rework the docs generator to support cross library references and make it beautiful
- [ ] Finish documenting the API everywhere
- [ ] Tutorials based on our exemplar packages
## Features
- [ ] Support multiple projects
- [x] Fold indicators
- [ ] Run apm from the command line without node
- [ ] Improve snippets
## API Polish
- [ ] Pick some exemplar packages and make all the APIs they utilize the best they can be (within reason).
- [ ] Marker API
- [ ] Remove shims / deprecated methods

data.title: Handle deleted files correctly
data.body:
Previously, if a file was open in Atom but deleted from the command line (or git, etc...) Atom would keep that buffer open and mark it as modified. This was annoying because when closing Atom it would prompt to be saved. This PR makes Atom treat deleted files as unmodified (unless the file was modified prior to deletion.)

One caveat still exists. The edit session for the deleted file will still be serialized. So a file that doesn't exist on disk will persist when you restart Atom until you explicitly close it. I'd like to wait and fix this problem after we decide on the future of panes.

Created to solve https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/693

data.title: Handle installation of `atom` script for users without system privilege
data.body:
This came out of the discussion on #1226 and it became clear that we don't handle the case well where users don't have proper permissions. 

Either we can ask for additional privileges or provide a way to put it in their custom path (like `~/bin`), not sure which is the best approach here.

data.title: Make default window size better
data.body:
Store the dimensions of the most recently resized window. When opening a directory for the first time default the dimensions to that size.

**Bonus Points**: Store different dimensions sizes based on monitor size. This would be useful for people with multiple displays.

Derived from https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1195

data.body: Doing this incrementally is going to take a few weeks off my lifespan, but here's the first step.

data.title: Mock season.writeFileSyne instead of fs.writeFileSync in config specs
data.body:
The spec suite has been overwriting my config directory in weird cases.
While investigating it I noticed that we mock writeFileSync directly in
these specs, but we actually use season to write the config cson. This
makes this spec a bit simpler because it doesn't have to parse the CSON
in the spec. Lower level assertions belong on the season package itself.

data.title: Ability to save files requiring admin access
data.body:
We should add support to save files that require admin access. The way Sublime Text does it is when you hit save, there is a dialog prompt for your password.

Currently this is the error thrown:

```
Uncaught Error: EACCES, permission denied '/private/etc/apache2/extra/httpd-vhosts.conf' - fs.js
```

data.title: Syntax/UI Theme Generator
data.body:
I have been toying with the idea of building a web app syntax/UI theme generator for users to customize and build their own themes for Atom. Being that the front-end for this app is built with HTML/CSS there are many more options for customizing the UI then users are used to and after spending many frustrating hours working with the Sublime Text UI theme files, having an interface to play around in instead would be a breath of fresh air. Something similar to the theme generator in Alfred if you've used that.

We could also expand this to include a live version of the editor that users could click around in and see their changes live, maybe include a section where users could download popular themes as well.

What do you guys think?

data.title: Context menus create more than one entry
data.body:
I think this has to do with how many times the selector matches a parent.

Check this:

``` coffeescript
'context-menu':
  '.tree-view .directory.entry':
    'Find in this directory': 'project-find:show-in-current-directory'
```

Here, there are two directory entries up the chain. So it makes two entries. No bueno. I can work around it for now, though.

![screen shot 2013-12-06 at 2 37 46 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/69169/1696622/4541d0e8-5ec7-11e3-9c8e-6496fa544feb.png)
